qas.question: Regional Italian dialects are often influenced by regional languages and what other language?
What do Italians in different regions never speak?
What is another term for national Italian dialects?
What dialect is regional Italian heavily influenced by native languages?
What is another term for varieties of standard Italian?
The majority of Italian languages are dialects of what?

context: Italians in different regions today may also speak <b1_0>regional <b2_0>varieties of <a0_0>standard Italian<b2_0/><b1_0/><a0_0/>, or <b4_0>regional Italian dialects<b4_0/>, which, unlike the majority of languages of Italy, are actually dialects of <b5_0>standard Italian<b5_0/> rather than separate languages. A <b3_0>regional Italian dialect<b3_0/> is generally standard Italian that has been heavily influenced or mixed with local or regional native languages and accents.
